body.p: A xmlcontent element tells where the module shall search for XML content. The template must have a processing instructions (PI) of type importxml, see: to realize the actual extraction of content.
A Module may contain any number of XMLContent elements.

tr.td: Any string that represents a file, either as an absolute URI or as an URI relative to the active anchor.

Any string that represents a file, either as an absolute URI or as an URI relative to the active anchor. Is used if location for some reason is not availabe. It is not a backup in the sense that the primary file is stored here. It is up to you to supply a meaningfull backup file.
A transformation identifier (see: ). The transformation may have parameter list: T(name='ole',address='Halden'). This transformation is overruled by a possible transformation in the actual import PI.
An id that identifies this xmlcontent in importxml in a template.

body.p: A xmlcontent element may not contain any elements
